job.title: Optometrist - Wagga Wagga (With relocation package)
job.description:
What's in it for you?

  • Flexible schedule can be Full-time/Part-time or locum
  • Salary package up to $140K + Super + OAA + AHPRA + $10K first year and $15K second year sign-on bonus + Bonus
  • Relocation bonus available
  • Career stability and guaranteed work-life balance!
  • A developing team culture, with new initiatives and programs to come to help motivate our staff.
  • Free glasses every six months.

Oscar Wylee

Oscar Wylee is one of Australia’s newest and fastest-growing optometry retailers. We are expanding quickly in Australia, New Zealand and Canada. We offer quality frames with exceptional service. We allow our optometrist and store managers to become partners with our business, so you are not just working for a salary, but for yourself!

The Role

As an Optometrist, you are the backbone of the business. You will have stability and a work-life balance. This role will develop you, it will inspire you, it will teach you, and it will reward you! 

You will be utilising your optical knowledge to provide professional eye care and service to every OW customer, you will represent our culture, beliefs, and value. 

Who you are:

  • Must have a degree in Optometry and hold a current AHPRA registration
  • Create a professional, friendly testing experience for every patient
  • Provide exceptional eye care and recommendations

This is an exciting time to jump on board, apply Today or contact reza.baniqued@oscarwylee.com for a confidential discussion.

*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job.title: Store Manager
job.description:
Oscar Wylee

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company who is constantly changing, growing and developing for the better. We are committed to exceptional customer service and patient care along with providing a unique product. Our continuous growth is due to our people who have made our brand what it is today.   

Values

Our motto is “change for the better.” Oscar Wylee is a diverse, welcoming and gender neutral brand that makes customers and staff feel warm and welcome. We value our product and the way our eyewear makes our people feel. By creating our own designs we cut out the middleman to decrease prices passing on savings to the customer.

The ideal candidate

Our ideal Store Manager is someone that has optical and management experience. Someone that is looking for a change or to grow. A team player and someone seeking work-life balance and not just because it is only 38 hours a week and a set roster, but also knowing that you won't be taking work home with you at the end of the day.

Locations and growth

Oscar Wylee has over 100 locations in Australia and New Zealand with full-time, part-time and locum positions available. We have roles in capital cities and regional areas with exceptional salary packages. But it doesn’t stop there, with new locations opening up constantly, Oscar Wylee is not slowing down any time soon!

Requirements

  • 1-2 years of assistant or store manager experience
  • Optical experience highly preferred
  • A team player
  • Someone that is looking to advance their career beyond store level

On offer

  • Career stability
  • Work life balance - no nights (except for possibly late night shopping nights), two consecutive days off and only a 38 hour week. 
  • Career Progression - at Oscar Wylee we provide our store managers with the opportunity for joint venture partnership or head office opportunities.
  • A developing team culture, with new initiatives and programs to come to help motivate our staff.
  • Perks - free glasses every six months.
  • Competitive salary and achievable KPIs.

job.title: Optométriste
job.description:
• Prime à la signature de l’offre $15 000
  • Cabinet flambant neuf avec des équipements de haute qualité
  • Entrée à faible risque financier avec un potentiel de gain non plafonné,

Notre marque est moderne, fraîche, dynamique et axée sur la mode avec une forte présence clinique. Nous sommes fiers de notre équipe, de nos produits et de nos clients. Nous produisons nos propres montures de lunettes de vue et de soleil, fabriquées à la main, à des prix abordables pour tous les budgets. 

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un/une optométriste en chef à temps plein, passionné(e) d’offrir des soins oculaires exemplaires et d’établir des liens durables avec ses patients. 

En tant que docteur en optométrie indépendant associé à Oscar Wylee, nous vous proposons une opération clé en main. 

  • Cabinet flambant neuf avec des équipements de haute qualité comprenant pré-tests, champs visuels et scanners rétiniens numériques,
  • Réservation en ligne, téléphone, internet, ordinateur et procédures de rappel des patients, 
  • Équipe de soutien qualifiée et aimable pour enregistrer les patients et faire le pré-test,
  • Soutien d’accueil, formation et développement continus des membres de l’équipe afin de fournir une expérience patient optimale, 
  • Entrée à faible risque financier avec un potentiel de gain non plafonné,
  • Prime à la signature de l’offre pour le/la candidat(e) retenu(e)

Nous sommes un revendeur et un prestataire de services cliniques optiques australien privé et exploité par des particuliers. Nous avons une forte passion pour l’amélioration et la croissance continues. Depuis 2012, nous avons étendu notre réseau à plus de 130 magasins à travers 3 pays, y compris 6 magasins au Canada.

Nous sommes un employeur soucieux de l'égalité des chances et tous les candidats qualifiés seront pris en considération pour un emploi sans tenir compte de la race, de la couleur, de la religion, du sexe, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'identité de genre, de l'origine nationale, du handicap, du statut de vétéran ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée par la loi.

Notre équipe dédiée compte plus de 1 000 employés dans le monde. 

Si vous êtes intéressé(e) de joindre un réseau global de prestataires de services d’optométrie en pleine croissance, n’hésitez pas à postuler. Nous sommes impatients de vous rencontrer !

job.title: Expression of Interest | Optometrist Graduates and Placements
job.description:
This is an amazing new opportunity for both Oscar Wylee and student/graduate optometrists to sign up and experience the Oscar Wylee difference! We have multiple locations around Australia and New Zealand and would be honoured to mentor future optometrists!

The Company

Oscar Wylee is a forward-thinking, growing eyewear specialist company that has developed strong core values in providing exceptional customer service, nurturing and developing our team and culture and providing a unique, affordable and trendy product. With these values, the business has grown dramatically over the last few years and we are looking for a dedicated optometrist to join the team. 

Values

Our motto is “change for the better.” Oscar Wylee is a diverse, welcoming and gender-neutral brand that makes customers and staff feel warm and welcome. We value our product and the way our eyewear makes our people feel and by creating our own designs we cut out the middleman to decrease prices passing on savings to the customer.

You

  • Currently undertaking or completed a degree in optometry
  • Passion for learning and development
  • A great culture fit, Oscar Wylee is about its people

On offer

  • Career stability
  • Work-life balance - no nights (except Thursdays), two consecutive days off and only a 38 hour week. The working week will be from Sunday to Thursday.
  • Career Progression - at Oscar Wylee we provide our staff with the opportunity for joint venture partnership, but also with the growing business we are giving staff the opportunity to grow in senior management and head office positions newly developed within the company.
  • A developing team culture, with new initiatives and programs to come to help motivate our staff.
  • Perks - free glasses every six months.
  • Competitive salary and achievable KPIs

job.title: Licensed Optician | Full-time
job.description:
We are looking for retail & optical superstars to be part of the exciting Oscar Wylee growth.

Oscar Wylee

We are a lifestyle brand with one objective to offer quality eyewear to customers at a revolutionary price. We care, we listen and we always want to be better! This is a great time to join us as we are expanding and growing our OW family, bigger than ever!

The Role

As a licensed optician your role is to provide exceptional customer service and eye care to every customer, Living our culture, beliefs and value. We value long-lasting customer relationships and as such responsibilities and duties include but are not limited to:

Responsibilities

Dispensing

  • Transpose customer prescriptions
  • Dispense prescriptions according to patient’s needs
  • Interpret prescriptions based on patients' feedback
  • Confidently dispense quality inspected eyewear
  • Strong understanding of the anatomy of the eye and ability to discuss with patients/customers
  • Recommend the most suitable glasses, styles, colours, and lenses to customers
  • Assist in submitting third party benefit claims
  • Remake, adjust and repair frames
  • Follow up on outstanding customer orders
  • Conduct pre-testing

Qualification

  • Provincial licence or certification by a nationally or provincially recognized opticianry college as an optician
  • Exceptional customer service and communication skills
  • Excellent time management and organizational ability
  • Delight even the most challenging customers
  • Ability to use initiative and adapt to different situations
  • Flexibility to work mall hours including evenings and weekends

Benefits

  • Supportive Team Environment
  • Ongoing training and development provided
  • Long Term Career Progression
  • 1 FREE pair of glasses every 6 months
  • Access to group benefits after 3 months of employment

Apply Today if you want to be part of something amazing!

job.title: Associate Optometrist
job.description:
Oscar Wylee

Our brand is modern, fresh, fashion-focused and dynamic with a solid clinical presence. We pride ourselves on our team, our product and our customers.

We are looking for an associate optometrist who is an independent doctor of optometry that will join with Oscar Wylee and work within the practice of an OW subleased optometrist as an independent contracted doctor. We would love to see someone passionate about providing exceptional eye care and building a lasting connection with their patients.

As an Associate Optometrist, we will provide:

  • Brand new practice with top-quality equipment
  • Turn-Key operation
  • Full professional discretion/clinical autonomy in agreement with your subleasing doctor
  • Pretest, Visual Field and Digital Retinal Scanner
  • Online booking, phone, Internet, computer, patient recall
  • Qualified friendly support team to check-in and pretest
  • Flexible working arrangements. Full-time or Part-time
  • Onboarding support, ongoing support to ensure success

We are a Family operated, Australian Optical company with a strong vision of continuous improvement and growth. Since 2012 we have grown our network to over 130 stores across 3 countries. We have a dedicated team of over 1500 employees.

To apply, please click on the appropriate link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact: dan.ranger@oscarwylee.com

job.title: Supervisor - Oscar Wylee Broadway
job.description:
What's in it for you?

  • Work in a supportive team environment and experience Oscar Wylee's vibrant culture
  • Create and make an impact in the retail segment
  • Learn and take your retail management skills to the next level.
  • Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

About Oscar Wylee

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand, and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique, and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions-focused, and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference in communities needing access to this important service. Our in-house designers are influenced by the latest global fashion trends and bring the product to the customer direct from our manufacturers.

About the role

Our Supervisors support our Store Managers to oversee the day-to-day operation of the retail arm of our service and ensure compliance with company policies and procedures, particularly when the Store Manager is not on shift.

They collaborate closely with our Optometrists to deliver a superior customer experience. They set a positive example for our store team members who also rely on their ability to resolve less complex problems.

About the person

This role suits a range of people including those who work in the retail and healthcare industries. Optical industry experience is helpful, but not essential. We are looking for effective and caring leaders who are organised, able to think on their feet, and make good decisions that support the continued growth of our brand. Other requirements:

  • Availability to work Sunday - Thursday.
  • Minimum 3 years of strong experience in customer-facing roles involving sales.
  • Experience supervising other workers and delivering on-site training to junior members of a team.
  • Ability to demonstrate the skill of building meaningful and long-term relationships with customers.
  • Collaborative and consultative teamwork and leadership style.

This is a great organisation for someone looking to continue to grow beyond a customer-facing role and we are often able to support relocation to meet the work-life needs of our staff.

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to reading your application.  

Due to the high volume of applications we typically receive for our roles we are only able to respond to shortlisted applications. However, by applying for this role you will have joined our talent community which will enable us to consider you for other opportunities with Oscar Wylee.

At Oscar Wylee, we pride ourselves on our culture and people. The culture is vibrant, supportive & exciting!

  • Vibrant Culture
  • Long Term Career Progression

Oscar Wylee

Oscar Wylee is a growing optical retailer that is recognised for it's culture and innovation. Our team is our soul! This is an incredible time to join the Oscar Wylee family as we are growing fast and we want you to grow with us. job.title: Lead Optometrist
job.description:
Our brand is modern, fresh, fashion-focused and dynamic with a solid clinical presence. We pride ourselves on our team, our product, and our customers. We produce our own handcrafted optical frames and sunglasses at an affordable price to meet any budget.

We are looking for a full-time Optometrist who is passionate about providing leading practice eye care and building a lasting connection with their patients.

This is an incredible time to jump on-board now as we have a generous offer package with sign-on bonus on offer $15000 . Talk to us today!

job.title: Licensed Optician
job.description:
2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Our brand is modern, fresh, fashion-focused and dynamic with a solid clinical presence. We pride ourselves on our team, our product, and our customers. We produce our own handcrafted optical frames and sunglasses at an affordable price to meet any budget.

About the role

Our Opticians are central to the success of our business as they have the crucial role of fulfilling the Optometrist's prescription and supporting our customers through the frame selection process.

We require a licensed Optician who is capable of delivering leading practice patient experience and provide a high standard of support to our Optometrists. It is critical that the Optician is capable of suitably complementing the advice of our Optometrists when talking to our patients about eye heath and strategies to maintain good eye health. Therefore, a strong understanding of the anatomy of the eye and a caring approach with patients is necessary.

In addition to standard dispensing duties, other typical duties involve:

  • Conduct pre-testing activities.
  • Assist with submitting third party benefit claims.
  • Remake, adjust and repair frames.
  • Follow up on outstanding customer orders.

About the person

At minimum the ideal applicant will have:

  • Appropriate provincial Optician license or certification by a nationally or provincially recognized opticianry college.
  • Whilst displaying a genuine care for eye health the Optician is also capable of confidently and effectively working with customers through the frame selection process.
  • Strong and effective time management and organizational skills.
  • Works with a sense of urgency and adaptability.
  • Flexibility to work mall hours including evenings and weekends.

We are a privately owned and operated Australian optical retailer and clinical service provider with a strong passion for continuous improvement and growth. Since 2012 we have grown our network to over 130 stores across three countries including 6 stores in Canada.

We have a dedicated team of over 1000+ employees globally.

Oscar Wylee is an innovative, unique optometry retailer that provides amazing service and dedicated optometry in Australia, New Zealand and Canada. At Oscar Wylee our frames are designed by us, offering affordable eyewear to our customers. Our people are the most important part of the growing success of Oscar Wylee with 130 stores and counting, this is an amazing time to join and be part of something truly amazing.

Oscar Wylee is looking for an energetic, passionate and customer service-oriented casual Optical Dispenser/Keyholders to join our team!

ABOUT OSCAR WYLEE

We are not your typical optical shop, Oscar Wylee has been recognized for our great culture and innovation. We are a lifestyle brand with one objective: to offer quality eyewear to customers at a revolutionary price.

We care, we listen and we always want to be better! This is a great time to join us as we are expanding and growing our OW family bigger than ever!

Responsibilities

  • Provide genuine eye care for customers by identifying needs, offering exceptional services and ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Provide professional recommendations 
  • Thorough understanding of the anatomy of the eye
  • Dispense complex lenses and frames according to individual needs
  • Assist with customers with frame selections
  • Create energy and excitement for customers
  • Consistently support and assist team members 
  • Drive brand awareness daily
  • Responsible for opening and closing procedures 

Requirements

  • 1-year experience in the Optical or retail industry
  • Optical Dispensing Cert IV is highly desirable
  • Experience in a fast-paced retail working environment
  • Clear communication skills and excellent listening skills
  • Highly motivated, positive and friendly
  • Strong people skills - you’re approachable and empathetic
  • A passion for delivering excellent customer service in every interaction

The Perks

  • Supportive Team Environment
  • Vibrant Culture
  • Long Term Career Progression
  • 1 FREE pair of glasses every 6 months
  • Monthly Incentives

Come join us today to experience the Oscar Wylee differences.

job.title: Talent Acquisition Manager
job.description:
Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, employing 1000+ world wide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions focused and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference to communities needing access to this important service. 

The Role

We have an opportunity for an experienced talent acquisition specialist to lead our recruitment function as a Talent Acquisition Manager, reporting to the Director of Retail Operations.

The Talent Acquisition Manager will lead a team of currently 6 Talent Acquisition Consultants and inspire them to deliver a leading practice candidate experience whilst also working to meet internal stakeholder needs.

This is a great opportunity for someone currently in a senior TA role seeking to step up or an experienced TA manager seeking to join a larger, global and expanding organisation. 

Hybrid way of working, currently three days in Sydney CBD office and two days from home.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage, mentor and inspire a team of Talent Acquisition Consultants to deliver leading practice candidate experience,

  • Review and improve talent acquisition policies, procedures and processes,
  • Manage end to end recruitment of specialist and Head Office roles when required (job posting, candidate screening, selection, onboarding, induction and document preparations)
  • Support development of talent pipeline through strategic networking, 
  • Develop and implement recruitment marketing campaigns to grow talent communities and workplace profile (inc. social media content),
  • Administer our applicant tracking system powered by LiveHire,
  • Develop non-standard reporting and analysis of recruitment activities,
  • Liaise with recruitment agencies.

  • Minimum 2 years experience as a Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant,

job.title: Retail Partner
job.description:
EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST

Do you get excited by the opportunity to grow a business and lead your own team?

As we continue to grow we are opening new stores and we want YOU to be a part of our growth.

About us

We are an Australian Optical company established in 2012 with a strong vision of continuous improvement and growth. We started our business online and have grown our network to 130 stores and are still growing!

Our brand is modern, fresh, fashion-focused and dynamic with a solid clinical presence.

We pride ourselves on our partnership with our team, our suppliers and our customers. Through these relationships, we have been able to build the foundation for clinical excellence, superior customer service and team engagement.

About the opportunity

Our core focus is to support owner-operated Optical professionals to build successful businesses. Our Joint Venture Partnership program is available for experienced Store Managers who are ready to take the next step to become a business owner and partner.

As the Retail Partner you will be responsible for the operations and profitability of the store with your team. You will be innovative and focused on maximising efficiency, productivity and performance of the business whilst providing a positive experience to all customers and work collaboratively with your team. You will also contribute to the business by supporting the Oscar Wylee strategy and adhere to industry regulations and compliance whilst promoting OW as the leading destination for Optical care.

You will earn a salary and receive a share of the profits. We take away the pressure of starting your own business by providing a professional support network and will nurture your leadership skills.

To succeed as a Partner it is preferred to have:

  • Certificate IV in Optical Dispensing
  • Minimum of 2 years management experience
  • The ability to influence, mentor, support and motivate team members
  • The ability to create a professional and friendly experience resulting in a customer for life
  • An innovative and collaborative approach
  • A passion to lead with an entrepreneur mindset

About the offer                               

Our Partnership agreements involve a market competitive salary package plus a profit share scheme. Work a 38 hour week with two consecutive days off.

We also offer financial support such as low-interest rate loans, and product and supply chain benefits.

Be part of a brand that is focused on delivering fashion-forward products and leading practice patient care.

We would love to hear from you, it’s as easy as completing the following form via our Joint Venture website at https://www.oscarwylee.com.au/joint_venture.html

job.description:
2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Our brand is modern, fresh, fashion-focused and dynamic with a solid clinical presence. We pride ourselves on our team, our product, and our customers. We produce our own handcrafted optical frames and sunglasses at an affordable price to meet any budget.

About the role

Our Opticians are central to the success of our business as they have the crucial role of fulfilling the Optometrist's prescription and supporting our customers through the frame selection process.

We require a licensed Optician who is capable of delivering leading practice patient experience and provide a high standard of support to our Optometrists. It is critical that the Optician is capable of suitably complementing the advice of our Optometrists when talking to our patients about eye heath and strategies to maintain good eye health. Therefore, a strong understanding of the anatomy of the eye and a caring approach with patients is necessary.

In addition to standard dispensing duties, other typical duties involve:

  • Conduct pre-testing activities.
  • Assist with submitting third party benefit claims.
  • Remake, adjust and repair frames.
  • Follow up on outstanding customer orders.

About the person

At minimum the ideal applicant will have:

  • Appropriate provincial Optician license or certification by a nationally or provincially recognized opticianry college.
  • Whilst displaying a genuine care for eye health the Optician is also capable of confidently and effectively working with customers through the frame selection process.
  • Strong and effective time management and organizational skills.
  • Works with a sense of urgency and adaptability.
  • Flexibility to work mall hours including evenings and weekends.

We are a privately owned and operated Australian optical retailer and clinical service provider with a strong passion for continuous improvement and growth. Since 2012 we have grown our network to over 130 stores across three countries including 6 stores in Canada.

We have a dedicated team of over 1000+ employees globally.

Talk to us today!

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply or contact Raj Sidhu at raj.sidhu@oscarwylee.com or 416-875-4734. 

We look forward to meeting you!

job.title: Optical Dispenser and Keyholder
job.description:
ABOUT OSCAR WYLEE

Oscar Wylee is an innovative, unique optometry retailer that provides amazing service and dedicated optometry in Australia, New Zealand and Canada. At Oscar Wylee our frames are designed by us, offering affordable eyewear to our customers. Our people are the most important part of the growing success of Oscar Wylee with 130 stores and counting, this is an amazing time to join and be part of something truly amazing.

Oscar Wylee is looking for an energetic, passionate and customer service-oriented casual Optical Dispenser/Keyholders to join our team!

ABOUT OSCAR WYLEE

We are not your typical optical shop, Oscar Wylee has been recognized for our great culture and innovation. We are a lifestyle brand with one objective: to offer quality eyewear to customers at a revolutionary price.

We care, we listen and we always want to be better! This is a great time to join us as we are expanding and growing our OW family bigger than ever!

Responsibilities

  • Provide genuine eye care for customers by identifying needs, offering exceptional services and ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Provide professional recommendations 
  • Thorough understanding of the anatomy of the eye
  • Dispense complex lenses and frames according to individual needs
  • Assist with customers with frame selections
  • Create energy and excitement for customers
  • Consistently support and assist team members 
  • Drive brand awareness daily
  • Responsible for opening and closing procedures 

Requirements

  • 1-year experience in the Optical or retail industry
  • Optical Dispensing Cert IV is highly desirable
  • Experience in a fast-paced retail working environment
  • Clear communication skills and excellent listening skills
  • Highly motivated, positive and friendly
  • Strong people skills - you’re approachable and empathetic
  • A passion for delivering excellent customer service in every interaction

The Perks

  • Supportive Team Environment
  • Vibrant Culture
  • Long Term Career Progression
  • 1 FREE pair of glasses every 6 months
  • Monthly Incentives

Come join us today to experience the Oscar Wylee differences.

job.title: Store Manager
job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions focused and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference to communities needing access to this important service. Our inhouse designers are influenced by the latest global fashion trends and bring the product to the customer direct from our manufacturers.

About the role

Store Managers oversee the day to day operation of the retail arm of our service and ensure compliance to company policies and procedures. They are key to the ongoing success of our services. They collaborate closely with our Optometrists to deliver a superior customer experience. Our store team members rely on their ability to coach effective selling and customer service skills.

About the person

This role suits are range of people including those who work in retail and healthcare industries. Optical industry experience is helpful, but not essential. We are looking for effective and caring leaders who are organised, able to think on their feet and make good decisions that support the continued growth of our brand. Other requirements:

  • 1 to 2 years of experience as an Assistant Store Manager (or similar) or higher retail management position.
  • Able to demonstrate experience working with budgets and scheduling staff in compliance with local labour laws.

This is a great organisation for someone looking to continue to grow beyond a customer facing role and we are often able to support relocation to meet the work-life needs of our staff.

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to reading your application.  

Due to the high volume of applications we typically receive for our roles we are only able to respond to shortlisted applications. However, by applying for this role you will have joined our talent community which will enable us to consider you for other opportunities with Oscar Wylee.

job.description:

We are looking for a person with a passion for leading practice e-commerce design and development to drive the planning, design and build of our customer e-commerce experience as well as collaborating with our team of graphics design and marketing professionals on campaigns, new product releases and events that are promoted on our websites.

This is a great role for an experienced developer that follows closely innovative global developments in e-commerce technology and seeks to work in an organisation where they can directly influence and make their mark for a global market changer! You see an opportunity, we want to hear it.

About the person

To succeed in this role you will require: 

  • Tertiary Qualifications in Information Technology or other relevant fields.
  • 2-3 years Frontend Web Development Experience.
  • Strong CSS and HTML skills and understanding of UX/UI. 
  • Knowledge of website architecture, and integrations.
  • Effective task prioritisation and time management skills are essential to ensuring deadlines are met. 
  • Actively keeps up to date with wed design and development leading practices and technological innovations.
  • Solutions focused, positive approach to change and a continuous improvement mindset is a must! 

Your prior professional experience should be sufficient to enable you to work independently and with minimal supervision. Also, being an effective team member and willingness to work with a geographically dispersed team is critical to organisational success. 

Experience using Figma, Adobe XD and other prototyping tools are highly desired. 

Join a market changing leader now!

job.title: Product Assistant
job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions focused and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference to communities needing access to this important service. Our inhouse designers are influenced by the latest global fashion trends and bring the product to the customer direct from our manufacturers.

About the role

Our business is expanding such that we now have a new opportunity for a person to join our Product team as a Product Assistant.

This is a great opportunity for someone with some experience working in a production and/or quality control environment who is keen to pursue a career in product management. The Product Assistant will:

  • Assist the product team to develop new products and improve existing products.
  • Conduct category reviews to identify new products that grow our range, sales and profit.
  • Conduct market/trend analysis to ensure product competitiveness.
  • Analyse sales data to understand product performance.
  • Maintain effective relationships with suppliers.
  • Accurately collate, enter and organise product data in business systems and databases.
  • Monitor the production and logistics process ensuring timely delivery of high quality products.
  • Perform quality inspections to ensure finished product meets quality standards and match agreed design specifications. 
  • Assist with organising product and campaign photoshoots.
  • Ensure Retail and Marketing teams are informed about new product features.
  • Minimise dated stock.

About the person

Ideal applicants will have:

  • A Bachelor degree involving product development, supply chain or marketing disciplines. 
  • Minimum one (1) year experience in a similar position. 
  • Good understanding of the end-to-end production and quality control processes. 
  • Commercial awareness.
  • Clear, concise and focused oral and written communication skills. 
  • An ability to take a logical and analytical approach to solving problems and resolving issues. 

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to reading your application.

job.title: Optical Dispenser and Keyholder
job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions focused and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference to communities needing access to this important service. Our inhouse designers are influenced by the latest global fashion trends and bring the product to the customer direct from our manufacturers.

About the role

We have a great blended fashion retail and healthcare experience to offer involving:

About the person

  • Strong attention to detail and basic mathematical skills

  • Capable of building trusting and respectful relationships
  • Self-motivated, positive and friendly manner

Optical Dispensing Certificate IV is highly desired, but not essential.

This is a great organisation for someone looking to continue to grow beyond a customer facing role and we are often able to support relocation to meet the work-life needs of our staff.

job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

job.title: Customer Service and Optical Assistant
job.description:
We are looking for retail & optical superstar to be part of the exciting Oscar Wylee growth on full-time capacity.

About the position

You will be trained and developed in all things Oscar Wylee, from customer service to our brand, our beliefs and how to maintain long-lasting customer relationships. Some key responsibilities include:

  • To provide warm, genuine care for customers by identifying needs, offering exceptional services and ensuring customer satisfaction.
  • To create energy and excitement for customers around Oscar Wylee products
  • To support and assist team members as one big family every day
  • To drive brand awareness by building customer relationships and establishing community

About you

  • Experienced in a fast-paced retail working environment
  • Clear communication skills
  • Highly motivated, positive and friendly
  • Strong people skills 
  • A passion for delivering excellent customer service in every interaction
  • Experience in the Optical industry is highly desirable

Benefits

  • Training provided
  • Supportive Team Environment
  • Vibrant Culture
  • Long Term Career Progression
  • 1 FREE pair of glasses every 6 months

Who is Oscar Wylee?

Oscar Wylee has been recognised for our great culture and innovation. We are a lifestyle brand with one objective: to offer quality eyewear to customers at a revolutionary price while leading the way for socially conscious businesses. 

We care, we listen and we always want to be better! This is a great time to join us as we are expanding and growing our OW family bigger than ever!

job.title: Finance Officer
job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions focused and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference to communities needing access to this important service. Our inhouse designers are influenced by the latest global fashion trends and bring the product to the customer direct from our manufacturers.

About the role

We have a new work-from-home opportunity for an experienced accounts and payroll professionals to join our finance team primarily located in Sydney, Australia. Reporting to the Director of Finance this role will assist our Canadian operations with:

  • Processing accounts payable, invoicing and accounts related reconciliations;
  • Preparing and processing journal entries;
  • Processing payroll and resolving related queries;
  • Maintaining databases holding personnel information;
  • Liaising with banks, vendors and other regulatory authorities;
  • Collecting documentation required for accounting, payroll and other employment related processes;
  • Respond to enquiries within the defined scope of the role and redirecting as appropriate;
  • Assist with new store set-ups as it relates to the finance and payroll functions (e.g. business registrations and insurance applications).

About the person

This is a great opportunity for a finance all-rounder. To succeed in this role you will require:

  • Advanced College Diploma (3 years), preferably in a business or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience;
  • Minimum two years of relevant work experience, preferably within retail industry;
  • Demonstrated strong experience processing payroll, accounts payable, expense reimbursements and account reconciliations;
  • Advanced computer skills with high level knowledge in MS Office including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook;
  • Strong data input skills, excellent attention to detail and organisation skills;
  • Ability to work under pressure and manage competing deadlines and priorities;
  • Excellent communication skills, verbal and written;
  • Sound knowledge of generally accepted accounting principals.

As we are expanding into Quebec an ability to speak French with relative fluency will be highly regarded!

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to reading your application.  

Due to the high volume of applications we typically receive for our roles we are only able to respond to shortlisted applications. However, by applying for this role you will have joined our talent community which will enable us to consider you for other opportunities with Oscar Wylee.

About the role

Store Managers oversee the day-to-day operation of the retail arm of our service and ensure compliance with company policies and procedures. They are key to the ongoing success of our services. About the person

This role suits a range of people including those who work in the retail and healthcare industries. Optical industry experience is helpful, but not essential. job.title: Regional Manager
job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand, and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique, and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions-focused, and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference in communities needing access to this important service. 

About the role

As a Regional Manager, you will be responsible for all aspects of retail operations across Canada. Supported by an experienced team of Store Managers, the team will be looking to their Regional Manager for coaching and guidance on the operational and strategic requirements of the business in their patch.

This role can be based anywhere but will include traveling and meeting with our amazing teams across Canada.

Core responsibilities:

  • Leading and assisting with the opening of new stores across the assigned region.
  • Monitoring budgets and rosters to ensure sales targets and KPIs are achieved.
  • Supporting the team to ensure stores operate to agreed lease terms and hours of operation.
  • Oversee the hiring activities of leadership and Optometry positions in Canada.
  • Work with stores to develop brand awareness; establish, maintain and expand the customer base.
  • Assist teams with solving complex problems and identifying non-conformances to procedures and processes; make recommendations for continuous improvement.
  • Implement company strategies and assist with change management activities.

About the person

This role would suit a person either in a similar role in the retail or healthcare industries, or perhaps someone who has strong retail management experience but seeking to further their career in a larger global organisation.

  • Ideally 3+ years of retail management experience supporting 20+ sites.
  • Ability to travel and visit different Oscar Wylee stores in Canada.
  • Qualifications in retail management or similar/relevant tertiary qualifications.
  • A strong collaborative leadership style that results in the development of meaningful relationships.
  • Ability to professionally and constructively influence all stakeholders, both upwards and across the assigned regions.
  • Solution and continuous improvement-focused approach to solving problems.
  • A genuine and sincere passion for customer service and health care.
  • Proven ability to coach effective sales and leadership skills.
  • Ability to make decisions quickly and think creatively.

Optical industry experience is helpful but not essential.

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to reading your application.  

Due to the high volume of applications we typically receive for our roles we are only able to respond to shortlisted applications. However, by applying for this role you will have joined our talent community which will enable us to consider you for other opportunities with Oscar Wylee.

Connect with us today and let us show you the OW difference.

job.title: Consultant(e) en Solutions et Services du Personnel (Généraliste RH)
job.description:
Recevez 2 x lunettes d’ordonnance gratuites par année civile pour vous garder toujours à la mode !

Oscar Wylee est une entreprise d’optométrie de premier plan avec plus de 130 magasins en Australie, en Nouvelle-Zélande et maintenant au Canada ! Nous employons plus de 1000 employés à travers le monde. Nous sommes engagés à dispenser des soins exceptionnels aux patients ainsi qu’à fournir à tout le monde un produit mode, unique et abordable.

Nous sommes un groupe ambitieux, dynamique et axé sur les solutions. Nous sommes passionnés par l’idée de faire un impact positif dans les communautés qui ont besoin d’avoir accès à ce service essentiel. Nos designers en interne sont influencés par les dernières tendances de la mode et ramènent le produit directement de nos fabricants jusqu’à nos clients. 

A propos du poste

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) professionnel(le) ayant une solide expérience dans les solutions et les services du personnel, afin de faciliter et superviser le parcours du cycle de vie des employés du début jusqu’à la fin, pour nos employés basés au Canada. 

Ce poste pourrait s’étendre au soutien d’une ou de plusieurs provinces dans lesquelles nous avons une activité, actuellement l’Alberta, la Nouvelle-Écosse, l’Ontario et bientôt la Colombie-Britannique et le Québec. 

Bien qu’il s’agisse d’un travail à domicile, des déplacements dans nos magasins d’optique seront prévus quand cela s’avère nécessaire, essentiellement pour aider les dirigeants sur le terrain lorsque des solutions à distance ne sont pas idéales.

Naturellement, ce type d’activité est entièrement financé et remboursé. 

Les activités fondamentales du poste concerné :

  • Recruter, du début jusqu’à la fin, pour nos postes basés au Canada, des Stylistes/Conseillers aux ventes de lunettes aux Optométristes et gérants de magasins. 
  • Faciliter les processus d’intégration et d’initiation. 
  • Aider les dirigeants et le personnel à résoudre les problèmes de rendement, de conduite et de comportement ; cela inclut les activités de rédaction d’une communication conforme et la tenue de dossiers. 
  • Fournir des conseils aux dirigeants et au personnel sur les lois pertinentes aux relations de travail et signaler les problèmes de conformité. 
  • Veiller à ce que les processus de séparation soient effectués. 
  • Aider les opérations de vente au détail avec les ouvertures de magasins et les activités de réinstallation, le cas échéant. 

A propos de la personne 

Les candidats retenus doivent avoir :

  • Les diplômes pertinents et, quand cela est nécessaire, les certifications permettant de fournir des conseils sur les sujets de relations de travail.
  • Maîtrise orale et écrite du français et idéalement, de l’anglais aussi. Au minimum, maîtrise de la communication professionnelle en anglais. 
  • Au moins 3 ans d’expérience dans un poste de Généraliste RH ou de Conseiller(ère).
  • Expérience dans la vente au détail ou les soins de la santé. 

Veuillez soumettre votre candidature si vous êtes intéressé(e) de joindre un réseau global de prestataires de services d’optométrie en pleine croissance. Nous sommes impatients d’examiner votre candidature.

A cause du très grand nombre de candidatures que nous recevons pour nos postes vacants, nous sommes capables de répondre uniquement aux candidatures retenues. Cependant, en postulant pour ce poste, vous aurez rejoint notre communauté de talents, ce qui nous permettra de considérer votre candidature pour d’autres opportunités chez Oscar Wylee.

job.title: Optometrist
job.description:
Oscar Wylee

Oscar Wylee is one of Australia’s newest and fastest-growing optometry retailers. We are expanding quickly in Australia, New Zealand and Canada. We offer quality frames with exceptional service. We allow our optometrist and store managers to become partners with our business, so you are not just working for a salary, but for yourself!

The Role

As an Optometrist, you are the backbone of the business. You will have stability and a work-life balance. This role will develop you, it will inspire you, it will teach you, and it will reward you! 

You will be utilising your optical knowledge to provide professional eye care and service to every OW customer, you will represent our culture, beliefs, and value. 

Who you are:

  • Create a professional, friendly testing experience for every patient
  • Provide exceptional eye care and recommendations
  • Work collaboratively with Oscar Wylee team members

The benefits:

  • Generous Salary package at 130K + Kiwisaver + Licence fees + 10k Signing Bonus
  • Experience the Oscar Wylee culture & work-life balance!
  • DRS + VFS available in-store
  • Career Progression - at Oscar Wylee we provide our optometrist and store managers with the opportunity for joint venture partnership or head office opportunities.
  • Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

This is an exciting time to jump on board, apply Today or contact jafra.ghribi@oscarwylee.com for a confidential discussion.

*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law

job.title: Lead Optometrist
job.description:
Our brand is modern, fresh, fashion-focused and dynamic with a solid clinical presence. We pride ourselves on our team, our product, and our customers. We produce our own handcrafted optical frames and sunglasses at an affordable price to meet any budget.

We are looking for a full-time Lead Optometrist who is passionate about providing leading practice eye care and building a lasting connection with their patients.

This is an incredible time to jump on-board now as we have a generous offer package with sign-on bonus on offer . Talk to us today!

As an independent doctor of optometry partnered with Oscar Wylee, we have a turn-key operation available for you.

  • Brand new practice with top-quality equipment including Pretest, Visual Field and Digital Retinal Scanners,
  • Online booking, phone, internet, computer and patient recall processes,
  • Qualified friendly support team to check-in and pretest,
  • Onboarding support, and ongoing training and development of team members to deliver optimal patient experience,
  • Low financial risk entry with uncapped earning potential.
  • Sign on bonus on offer for successful candidate

We are a privately owned and operated Australian optical retailer and clinical service provider with a strong passion for continuous improvement and growth. Since 2012 we have grown our network to over 130 stores across three countries including 6 stores in Canada. We have a dedicated team of over 1000+ employees globally.

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to meeting you!

job.title: Licensed Optician
job.description:
2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Our brand is modern, fresh, fashion-focused and dynamic with a solid clinical presence. We pride ourselves on our team, our product, and our customers. We produce our own handcrafted optical frames and sunglasses at an affordable price to meet any budget.

About the role

Our Opticians are central to the success of our business as they have the crucial role of fulfilling the Optometrist's prescription and supporting our customers through the frame selection process.

We require a licensed Optician who is capable of delivering leading practice patient experience and provide a high standard of support to our Optometrists. It is critical that the Optician is capable of suitably complementing the advice of our Optometrists when talking to our patients about eye heath and strategies to maintain good eye health. Therefore, a strong understanding of the anatomy of the eye and a caring approach with patients is necessary.

In addition to standard dispensing duties, other typical duties involve:

  • Conduct pre-testing activities.
  • Assist with submitting third party benefit claims.
  • Remake, adjust and repair frames.
  • Follow up on outstanding customer orders.

About the person

At minimum the ideal applicant will have:

  • Appropriate provincial Optician license or certification by a nationally or provincially recognized opticianry college.
  • Whilst displaying a genuine care for eye health the Optician is also capable of confidently and effectively working with customers through the frame selection process.
  • Strong and effective time management and organizational skills.
  • Works with a sense of urgency and adaptability.
  • Flexibility to work mall hours including evenings and weekends.

We are a privately owned and operated Australian optical retailer and clinical service provider with a strong passion for continuous improvement and growth. Since 2012 we have grown our network to over 130 stores across three countries including 6 stores in Canada.

We have a dedicated team of over 1000+ employees globally.

Talk to us today!

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply or contact Raj Sidhu at raj.sidhu@oscarwylee.com or 416-875-4734. 

We look forward to meeting you!

job.title: Safety and Wellbeing Specialist
job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions focused and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference to communities needing access to this important service. Our inhouse designers are influenced by the latest global fashion trends and bring the product to the customer direct from our manufacturers.

About the role

This is a new and exciting opportunity reporting to the Head of People Services that will have a key role in shaping how we manage safety in our workplaces and enhance worker wellbeing globally. This role primarily involves:

  • Rebuilding, broadening and ongoing improvements to our SMS ensuring its compliance to local OHS laws. 
  • Review, elevate and develop leading practice safety and wellbeing documentation and learning content for new and existing staff.
  • Facilitate and manage health and safety consultation activities.
  • Provide advice and coach others on matters concerning safety and all aspects of wellbeing.
  • End to end management of reported incidents and return to work activities. 
  • Source and recommend vendors and suppliers of safety and wellbeing orientated services; and where engaged manage any ongoing agreements.
  • Manage corporate funded health and life insurance plans.
  • Recommend safety and wellbeing strategies to address identified risks.
  • Develop and deliver regular safety and wellbeing reporting to KMPs.

Whilst this is a stand-alone position, our expanding head office currently has the internal capabilities to support this position with some administration, graphic design and other SMEs for content development and advice on industry practices.

This is a great opportunity for an experienced safety and wellbeing professional to take the next step in their journey towards becoming a Safety and Wellbeing Manager.

About the person

We're looking for someone who is passionate about safety and all aspects of wellbeing. The preferred applicant will have a:

  • Bachelor or Masters degree involving core studies in OHS. Completed either in Australia, New Zealand or Canada.
  • 3-5 years of experience working in a work, health and safety team.
  • Preferably experience in either retail, hospitality or health care sectors.
  • Strong oral or written communication skills.
  • Some experience preparing business cases and change management.
  • Strong attention to detail and Excel or Google Sheet experience.

Understanding of ISO45001, quality and risk management an advantage.

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to reading your application.  

Due to the high volume of applications we typically receive for our roles we are only able to respond to shortlisted applications. However, by applying for this role you will have joined our talent community which will enable us to consider you for other opportunities with Oscar Wylee.

job.title: Conseiller aux ventes
job.description:
Recevez 2 x lunettes d’ordonnance gratuites par année civile pour vous garder toujours à la mode !

Oscar Wylee est une entreprise d’optométrie de premier plan avec plus de 130 magasins au Canada, en Australie et en Nouvelle-Zélande, employant plus de 1000 employés à travers le monde. Nous sommes engagés à dispenser des soins exceptionnels aux patients ainsi qu’à fournir à tout le monde un produit mode, unique et abordable.

Nous sommes un groupe ambitieux, dynamique et axé sur les solutions. Nous sommes passionnés par l’idée de faire un impact positif dans les communautés qui ont besoin d’avoir accès à ce service essentiel. Nos designers en interne sont influencés par les dernières tendances de la mode et ramènent le produit directement de nos fabricants jusqu’à nos clients. 

A propos du poste

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un/une Styliste / Conseiller(ère) aux ventes de lunettes, dynamique, passionné(e) et axé(e) sur le service client, pour rejoindre notre équipe sympathique de professionnels cliniques et de vente au détail. 

C’est une superbe expérience alliant la vente au détail de produits mode aux soins de la santé, en fournissant des conseils de soins oculaires et de stylisme de lunettes aux patients et aux clients potentiels. 

Nos Styliste / Conseiller(ère) aux ventes de lunettes aident nos clients dans le choix de leurs montures et augmentent la notoriété de la marque. 

Ils construisent des relations fructueuses avec notre clientèle, lui fournissant ainsi une raison pour nous revisiter. 

A propos de la personne

  • Au moins 1 année d’expérience dans un magasin d’optique, ou bien au moins 2 années d’expérience en vente au détail
  • Grand souci du détail et compétences mathématiques de base
  • Compétences en communication claires, efficaces et confiantes
  • Capable de construire des relations de confiance et de respect
  • Motivé(e), positif(ve) et amical(e)

C’est une entreprise parfaite pour quelqu’un cherchant à continuer d’évoluer au-delà d’un rôle d’interface client et nous sommes souvent capable de soutenir un déménagement afin de contribuer à l’équilibre travail-vie privée de notre personnel. 

Veuillez soumettre votre candidature si vous êtes intéressé(e) de joindre un réseau global de prestataires de services d’optométrie en pleine croissance. Nous sommes impatients d’examiner votre candidature.

A cause du très grand nombre de candidatures que nous recevons pour nos postes vacants, nous sommes capables de répondre uniquement aux candidatures retenues. Cependant, en postulant pour ce poste, vous aurez rejoint notre communauté de talents, ce qui nous permettra de considérer votre candidature pour d’autres opportunités chez Oscar Wylee.

job.title: Opticien(ne) agrée(e)
job.description:
• 2 x lunettes d’ordonnance gratuites par année civile pour vous garder toujours à la mode !
  • Magasin flambant neuf
  • Être ambassadeur d’une marque moderne, fraîche, dynamique en pleine expansion

Notre marque est moderne, fraîche, dynamique et axée sur la mode avec une forte présence clinique. Nous sommes fiers de notre équipe, de nos produits et de nos clients. Nous produisons nos propres montures de lunettes de vue et de soleil, fabriquées à la main, à des prix abordables pour tous les budgets. 

A propos du rôle:

Nos opticiens sont essentiels pour le succès de notre activité car ils ont le rôle crucial de remplir l’ordonnance de l’optométriste et d’aider nos clients dans la procédure de choix des montures.  

Nous recherchons un(e) opticien(ne) agrée(e) capable d’offrir une expérience patient exemplaire et de fournir un soutien de haute qualité à nos optométristes. Il est indispensable que l’opticien(ne) soit capable de compléter parfaitement les conseils de nos optométristes en parlant à nos patients de la santé oculaire et des stratégies nécessaires pour maintenir une bonne santé oculaire. Pour cela, il est nécessaire d’avoir une forte compréhension de l’anatomie des yeux et une approche attentionnée aux patients. 

En plus des tâches de dispensation standard, d’autres taches typiques comprennent : 

  • Mener les activités de pré-test
  • Aider à soumettre les demandes de règlement des avantages de tierce partie
  • Refaire, ajuster et réparer les montures
  • Suivre les commandes des clients en attente


A propos de la personne

Au minimum, le/la candidat(e) idéal(e) doit avoir :

  • Un diplôme d’opticien provincial approprié ou une certification par une école d’opticiens reconnue au niveau national ou provincial. 
  • Tout en montrant un intérêt réel pour les soins oculaires, l’opticien(ne) doit aussi être capable d’aider les clients pendant la procédure de choix des montures, d’une manière efficace et sûre. 
  • Compétences solides et efficaces en matière de gestion du temps et d’organisation.
  • Travail avec un sens de l’urgence et une bonne adaptabilité.
  • Flexibilité pour travailler pendant les heures d’ouvertures des centres commerciaux, y compris les soirées et les fins de semaine. 


Nous sommes un revendeur et un prestataire de services cliniques optiques australien privé et exploité par des particuliers. Nous avons une forte passion pour l’amélioration et la croissance continues. Depuis 2012, nous avons étendu notre réseau à plus de 130 magasins à travers 3 pays, y compris 6 magasins au Canada.

Notre équipe dédiée compte plus de 1 000 employés dans le monde. 

Si vous êtes intéressé(e) de joindre un réseau global de prestataires de services d’optométrie en pleine croissance, contactez-nous dès aujourd’hui ! Nous sommes impatients de vous rencontrer !

  • Monitoring and ensuring employee work rights records are accurate and up to date. 
  • Monitoring on-boarding, cross-boarding and off-boarding processes, ensure critical steps are carried out by relevant stakeholders.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is currently studying a degree majoring in Human Resources/Industrial Relations, or has recently completed such a degree in an Australian university; and looking for their first opportunity to work in this area of business.

This is an incredible time to join the Oscar Wylee family as we are growing fast and we want you to grow with us. As a optical assistant you will be provided with all the training you need to succeed with a fun and supportive team to assist you in your journey.


Key Responsibilities

  • Achieve sales targets and provide genuine eye care for customers by identifying needs, offering exceptional services and ensuring customer satisfaction.
  • Provide professional recommendations 
  • Dispense complex lenses and frames according to individual needs.
  • Create energy and excitement for customers
  • Consistently support and assist team members 
  • Drive brand awareness 

You

  • Optical experience not essential, but highly desired.
  • Experience in a fast-paced retail working environment
  • Clear communication skills and excellent listening skills
  • Highly motivated, positive, and friendly
  • Strong people skills - you’re approachable and empathetic
  • A passion for delivering excellent customer service in every interaction

Benefits

  • Supportive Team Environment
  • Vibrant Culture
  • Long Term Career Progression
  • 1 FREE pair of glasses every 6 months
  • Monthly Incentives

To find out more about Oscar Wylee visit: https://www.oscarwylee.com.au/

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law

job.title: Store Manager
job.description:
Receive 2 x free prescription eyewear per calendar year to keep you on trend!

Oscar Wylee is a leading optometry company with 130+ stores located in Australia, New Zealand and Canada, employing 1000+ worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional patient care along with providing an affordable, unique and fashionable product to all. 

We are an ambitious, solutions focused and energetic group passionate about making a positive difference to communities needing access to this important service. Our inhouse designers are influenced by the latest global fashion trends and bring the product to the customer direct from our manufacturers.

About the role

Store Managers oversee the day to day operation of the retail arm of our service and ensure compliance to company policies and procedures. They are key to the ongoing success of our services. They collaborate closely with our Optometrists to deliver a superior customer experience. Our store team members rely on their ability to coach effective selling and customer service skills.

About the person

This role suits are range of people including those who work in retail and healthcare industries. Optical industry experience is helpful, but not essential. We are looking for effective and caring leaders who are organised, able to think on their feet and make good decisions that support the continued growth of our brand. Other requirements:

  • 1 to 2 years of experience as an Assistant Store Manager (or similar) or higher retail management position.
  • Able to demonstrate experience working with budgets and scheduling staff in compliance with local labour laws.

This is a great organisation for someone looking to continue to grow beyond a customer facing role and we are often able to support relocation to meet the work-life needs of our staff.

If you are interested in joining a growing global network of optometry service providers please apply. We look forward to reading your application.  

Due to the high volume of applications we typically receive for our roles we are only able to respond to shortlisted applications. However, by applying for this role you will have joined our talent community which will enable us to consider you for other opportunities with Oscar Wylee.
